Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: The apparent assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump on Sept. 15, 2024, was “staged.”
Matched Articles.Justification: Authorities arrested 58-year-old Ryan Wesley Routh on Sept. 15, whom they said pointed a gun through the fence at Trump International Golf Club in West Palm Beach, Florida, where former President Donald Trump was golfing. The FBI said it is investigating the event as "what appears to be an assassination attempt" against Trump. The investigation is ongoing, but neither the FBI nor local authorities have said it was staged. Authorities recovered evidence, including an AK-47-style rifle, from a spot along the fence surrounding Trump’s golf course. The suspect has been arrested and charged with two federal gun crimes.
Sources: U.S. District Court Southern District of Florida

source_claims.claim: The apparent assassination attempt against former President Donald Trump on Sept. 15, 2024, was “staged.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Image of people boarding up a window shows Michigan election officials are “preparing to steal this election”
Matched Articles.Justification: This photo was taken in Tampa, Florida, in 2023, ahead of Hurricane Idalia.

source_claims.claim: Image of people boarding up a window shows Michigan election officials are “preparing to steal this election”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: The American flag is missing from the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.
Matched Articles.Justification: Images show there were at least six flags onstage the first day of the Democratic National Convention.

source_claims.claim: The American flag is missing from the Democratic National Convention in Chicago.

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Video shows “the bunker-busting bombs that ended the lives of (Hassan) Nasrallah and Hezbollah’s leadership.”
Matched Articles.Justification: Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah was killed at night in an Israeli airstrike Sept. 27 in a Beirut, Lebanon, suburb. Social media videos that claim to show Israeli bombs striking buildings with Nasrallah and other Hezbollah leadership inside were taken in daylight, and many are from earlier bombings in Gaza.

source_claims.claim: Video shows “the bunker-busting bombs that ended the lives of (Hassan) Nasrallah and Hezbollah’s leadership.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Photo shows a toilet after “some Hezbollah operative blew up.”
Matched Articles.Justification: This photo was taken in 2020 in Hong Kong after an improvised explosive device exploded in a public toilet there. It had nothing to do with the pager-linked explosions in Lebanon and Syria in 2024.

source_claims.claim: Photo shows a toilet after “some Hezbollah operative blew up.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: “BREAKING: Apalachee High School shooter has been identified as non-binary trans girl Samantha Hyde.”
Matched Articles.Justification: The name "Samantha Hyde" is a variation of Sam Hyde, a name we have seen social media users resurface as a meme when shootings occur. Authorities identified the suspect in the fatal Sept. 4 shooting at Apalachee High School as 14-year-old Colt Gray.
Sources: Georgia Bureau of Investigation Facebook post
Georgia Bureau of Investigation YouTube video
Jackson County Sheriff’s Office incident report

source_claims.claim: “BREAKING: Apalachee High School shooter has been identified as non-binary trans girl Samantha Hyde.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: An executive of the gay dating app Grindr said the Republican National Convention is "basically Grindr’s Super Bowl.'”
Matched Articles.Justification: The claim originated from a satire account. We found no credible reports that the company’s CEO called the Republican National Convention Grindr’s Super Bowl.

source_claims.claim: An executive of the gay dating app Grindr said the Republican National Convention is "basically Grindr’s Super Bowl.'”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Video shows Donald Trump sleeping at the Republican National Convention’s first night.
Matched Articles.Justification: Longer video footage from the event shows that former President Donald Trump closed his eyes during a prayer.

source_claims.claim: Video shows Donald Trump sleeping at the Republican National Convention’s first night.

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Photo shows “pallets or containers of bricks have been found near locations designated for protests related to the Democratic National Convention”
Matched Articles.Justification: This photo is from 2020 in Dallas. The bricks were near a construction site. Officials with Chicago’s Democratic National Convention Joint Information Center said Aug. 20 that brick pallets had not been found near protest sites. We last saw a rash of similarly misleading claims about bricks and protest sites in 2020, during social justice protests across the nation in response to George Floyd’s murder.
Sources: Email interview with DNC 2024 Joint Information Center

source_claims.claim: Photo shows “pallets or containers of bricks have been found near locations designated for protests related to the Democratic National Convention”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: LGBTQ+ leaders sign World Economic Forum treaty to “Accept Pedophiles as 'Legally Protected Minority’”
Matched Articles.Justification: This claim originated on The People’s Voice, a website that frequently publishes false information. The 10-minute video in the post includes zero evidence to support the claim or details about what treaty or LGBTQ+ leaders it refers to. PolitiFact could find no evidence such a treaty to "accept pedophiles as a legally protected minority" exists, and a World Economic Forum spokesperson said the claim is fabricated.

source_claims.claim: LGBTQ+ leaders sign World Economic Forum treaty to “Accept Pedophiles as 'Legally Protected Minority’”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Tim Walz “changed the Minnesota flag so it could resemble the Somalian flag.”
Matched Articles.Justification: After a monthslong selection process, a Minnesota commission chose a new design for the state’s flag that was adopted May 11. The flag includes a star and blue coloring, as does Somalia’s national flag, but Somalia’s flag was not an inspiration, said a Minnesota man whose flag concept inspired the final design. The Minnesota flag has an eight-pointed star, while Somalia’s star is five-pointed. The dark blue surrounding the star on the Minnesota flag represents the state’s shape and the light blue on the right represents the state’s abundant lakes and rivers.
Sources: Office of the Minnesota Secretary of State Steve Simon

source_claims.claim: Tim Walz “changed the Minnesota flag so it could resemble the Somalian flag.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Maryland bridge collapse was a false flag operation to distract from other events.
Matched Articles.Justification: A container ship lost power as it approached the Francis Scott Key Bridge, a major artery into Baltimore. The ship crashed into a pillar of the bridge, causing the structure’s collapse. Maryland officials said it was an accident. No spin, just facts you can trust.Here's how we do it.

source_claims.claim: Maryland bridge collapse was a false flag operation to distract from other events.

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Sen. Katie Britt introduced a bill “to create a national registry of pregnant women.”
Matched Articles.Justification: Sen. Katie Britt, R-Ala., introduced a bill that would create pregnancy.gov, a federal website with resources for pregnant women and mothers. The resources would exclude information from organizations that provide abortions. The bill doesn’t mention the words "registry" or "database." It says that if website users choose to take an "assessment" available through the website, they can consent to share their contact information "which the (Department of Health and Human Services) Secretary may use to conduct outreach via phone or email to follow up with users on additional resources." The bill doesn’t explain how this collected data would be handled or who would have access to it. Critics said that vagueness poses concerns for pregnant women’s privacy.
Sources: Phone interview with Dr. Rob Davidson
Phone interviews and email exchanges with Sean Ross
The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists

source_claims.claim: Sen. Katie Britt introduced a bill “to create a national registry of pregnant women.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Mel Gibson released a video of Bill and Hillary Clinton engaging in cannibalism with “Haitian cannibal gang leader ‘Barbecue!’”
Matched Articles.Justification: Mel Gibson’s publicist said Gibson did not release a video of the Clintons engaging in cannibalism. No such video exists online. Learn more about PolitiFact’sfact-checking process and rating system.

source_claims.claim: Mel Gibson released a video of Bill and Hillary Clinton engaging in cannibalism with “Haitian cannibal gang leader ‘Barbecue!’”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: “Rep. Dean Phillips received almost twice as many votes as Biden did in the New Hampshire primary.”
Matched Articles.Justification: Rep. Dean Phillips, D-Minn., got about 24,000 votes in the New Hampshire Democratic primary. President Biden got more than 79,000. President Biden did not appear on the ballot because of a disagreement between the state and national Democratic Party, but a widespread campaign was organized for Biden as a write-in candidate. There is no evidence of large-scale election fraud in the 2024 New Hampshire primary.
Sources: Email interview with Bradford E. Cook

source_claims.claim: “Rep. Dean Phillips received almost twice as many votes as Biden did in the New Hampshire primary.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Jimmy Kimmel was on the Jeffrey Epstein list, documents show.
Matched Articles.Justification: Comedian and TV host Jimmy Kimmel was not mentioned in the first batch of court documents released Jan. 3 from a 2015 sex trafficking lawsuit related to Jeffrey Epstein. A document widely shared on X showing a document describing a sexual encounter with Kimmel is fake. The Citizens Free Press said an image showing that it shared the document on X was fake. It also affirmed that Kimmel is not named in the official court documents released Jan. 3.

source_claims.claim: Jimmy Kimmel was on the Jeffrey Epstein list, documents show.

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Photo shows “Palestinian activists” blocking “Jewish students from entering Columbia University.”
Matched Articles.Justification: The Associated Press took the photo Oct. 12, 2023. The caption does not say it shows protesters blocking Jewish students from entering campus.
Sources: Columbia University Office of Public Affairs

source_claims.claim: Photo shows “Palestinian activists” blocking “Jewish students from entering Columbia University.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Video shows Slovakia Prime Minister Fico speaking against the World Health Organization the week before he was the target of an assassination attempt.
Matched Articles.Justification: Slovakian Prime Minister Robert Fico made this speech during an assembly in November 2023, not a "week" before he got shot. Slovakian Interior Minister Matúš Šutaj Eštok said the 71-year-old charged with trying to assassinate Fico did not belong to a political party but was politically motivated. Fico’s position on the World Health Organization’s pandemic plan was not among the policies Šutaj Eštok said the suspect mentioned as being objectionable.
Sources: X post by Marjorie Taylor Greene

source_claims.claim: Video shows Slovakia Prime Minister Fico speaking against the World Health Organization the week before he was the target of an assassination attempt.

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: A March 7 U.S. security alert … means the U.S. was “behind this gruesome terror attack on Russian civilians.”
Matched Articles.Justification: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the Moscow concert hall attacks. The U.S. warned Russia about the terror attack as part of a long-standing policy to alert other nations — even adversaries — about credible threats. The advance warning is not evidence that the U.S. perpetrated the attack. No spin, just facts you can trust.Here's how we do it.
Sources: Email interview with Geoffrey S. Corn
Email interview with Paul R. Pillar of the Georgetown University’s Center for Security Studies
Office of the Director of National Intelligence
U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General
U.S. Embassy and Consulates in Russia

source_claims.claim: A March 7 U.S. security alert … means the U.S. was “behind this gruesome terror attack on Russian civilians.”

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Video shows hecklers April 16 booing Joe Biden’s motorcade in his hometown of Scranton, Pennsylvania.
Matched Articles.Justification: This footage is from President Joe Biden’s  2021 visit to his hometown of Scranton, Pennsylvania. It was not filmed in 2024.

source_claims.claim: Video shows hecklers April 16 booing Joe Biden’s motorcade in his hometown of Scranton, Pennsylvania.

Matched Articles.Speaker: tweets
Matched Articles.Main Claim: Fired Milwaukee election leader “printed 64,000 ballots in a back room at City Hall in Milwaukee and had random employees fill them out,” giving Joe Biden the lead.
Matched Articles.Justification: A spokesperson for Milwaukee Mayor Cavalier Johnson said Claire Woodall was not replaced as executive director of the Milwaukee Election Commission because of improper conduct related to the 2020 Wisconsin election. The claim that Woodall printed 64,000 ballots and had employees fill them out to favor Joe Biden originated with a Wisconsin man who has filed numerous lawsuits against Wisconsin officials, none of which have produced evidence of this claim. Milwaukee ballots are printed by city vendors, and the city does not have the capability to print 64,000 ballots, the mayoral spokesperson said.
Sources: Deposition of Claire Woodall in Peter Bernegger vs. Claire Woodall-Vogg

source_claims.claim: Fired Milwaukee election leader “printed 64,000 ballots in a back room at City Hall in Milwaukee and had random employees fill them out,” giving Joe Biden the lead.
